result.execSummary:
The defendant Iesha M Glass was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Report for probation by 5 p.m. on 9/23/2022.

miscConds.notes:
Complete a Batterers Intervention Program.
Mental health assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.
Complete a parenting class.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

No contact with victim without the approval of the Court.
No weapons.
Work/school or a combination of both.
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Provide a DNA sample.
Pay DV fee.
Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Court waives all nonmandatory costs, fees and surcharges.
Court set restitution at $0.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Iesha M Glass

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Iesha M Glass appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Iesha M Glass.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:

- Report for Probation by 5pm on 9/23/2022.
- Complete a batters intervention program.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Complete a parenting class.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- No contact with victim without the approval of the Court.  
- Work/School or a combination of both.
- No weapons.
- Court set restitution at $0.
- Pay DV fee.
- Provide a DNA sample.

- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

*** Court DENIES expungement request

Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defendant Iesha M Glass appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Iesha M Glass.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. 

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed but read-in for sentencing purposes.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.

Defendant Iesha M Glass in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Josh Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Defense requests resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Iesha M Glass in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Court authorizes transfer of this case to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 4 for global resolution. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defense counsel requests an adjournment. Court grants request. Court adjourns case to 5/19/2022 at 1:30 pm for status conference. Parties notified.

Defendant Iesha M Glass in court.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with JS, DOB 4/26/96
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Iesha M Glass in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Iesha M Glass in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Iesha M Glass appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Case reassigned due to intake week.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/30/22 @ 2p
